00002 //
00003 // C++ Implementation: test
00004 //
00005 // Description: TreeNode datastructure for implementing AST Tree
00006 //
00007 //
00008 // Author: srinivas muddana, <smuddana@cise.ufl.edu>, (C) 2009
00009 //
00010 // Copyright: See COPYING file that comes with this distribution
00011 //
00012 //
00013 //first child next sibling notation of a n-ry tree
00014   class TreeNode{
00015   public:
00016     void flatten(Control *, vector<Control *> *);
00017 
00018     enum Type {
00019       LAMBDA = 1 ,
00020       WHERE = 2 ,
00021       TAU = 3 ,
00022       AUG = 4 ,
00023       TERNARY = 5 ,
00024       OR = 6 ,
00025       AND_LOGICAL = 7 ,
00026       NOT = 8 ,
00027       GR = 9 ,
00028       GE = 10 ,
00029       LS = 11 ,
00030       LE = 12 ,
00031       EQ = 13 ,
00032       NE = 14 ,
00033       PLUS = 15 ,
00034       MINUS = 16 ,
00035       NEG = 17 ,
00036       MULTIPLY = 18 ,
00037       DIVIDE = 19 ,
00038       POWER = 20 ,
00039       AT = 21 ,
00040       GAMMA = 22 ,
00041       TRUE = 23 ,
00042       FALSE = 24 ,
00043       NIL = 25 ,
00044       DUMMY = 26 ,
00045       WITHIN = 27 ,
00046       AND = 28 ,
00047       REC= 29 ,
00048       BINDING = 30 ,
00049       FCN_FORM = 31 ,
00050       EMPTY_BRACKET = 32 ,
00051       COMMA = 33 ,
00052       LET = 34 ,
00053       IDENTIFIER = 35 ,
00054       STRING = 36 ,
00055       INTEGER = 37,
00056       YSTAR = 38
00057     };
00058     TreeNode *lft,*rgt;
00059     TreeNode(string val, Type type): _value(val) , _type(type){
00060       //_value = val;
00061       //_type = type;
00062       _init_lft_rgt();
00063     };
00064     TreeNode(Type type): _type(type){
00065       //_type = type;
00066       _init_lft_rgt();
00067     };
00068     //pre-order treversal first root then the left and right child recursively
00069     void pretty_print();
00070 
00071     string to_s();
00072 
00073     void standardize();
00074     void add_child(TreeNode *child);
00075 
00076     string _value;
00077     Type _type;
00078   private:
00079     void _standardize(){
00080       TreeNode *p, *e, *e1, *e2, *x, *x1, *x2, *n, *temp, *new_temp;
00081 
00082       if(lft != NULL){
00083         lft->standardize();
00084       };
00085       if(rgt != NULL){
00086         rgt->standardize();
00087       };
00088       switch(_type){
00089       case LET :
00090         if(lft->_type != BINDING){
00091           throw "Subtree not standardised: case LET";
00092         }
00093         _type = GAMMA;
00094         lft->_type = LAMBDA;
00095         p = lft->rgt;
00096         lft->rgt = lft->lft->rgt;
00097         lft->lft->rgt = p;
00098         break;
00099       case WHERE:
00100         if(lft->rgt->_type != BINDING){
00101           throw "Subtree not standardised: case WHERE";
00102         };
00103         _type = GAMMA;
00104         p = lft;
00105         x = lft->rgt->lft;
00106         e = lft->rgt->lft->rgt;
00107         p->rgt = NULL; // dissociating P with =
00108         x->rgt = NULL; // dissociating X with E
00109         lft = new TreeNode(LAMBDA);
00110         lft->rgt = e;
00111         lft->lft = x;
00112         x->rgt = p;
00113         break;
00114       case WITHIN:
00115         if(lft->_type != BINDING || lft->rgt->_type != BINDING){
00116           throw "Subtree not standardised: case WITHIN";
00117         };
00118         _type = BINDING;
00119         x1 = lft->lft;//x1 and its next siblling(rgt) is E1
00120         x2 = lft->rgt->lft;
00121         //swapping e1 and e2
00122         e1 = x1->rgt;
00123         x1->rgt = x2->rgt;
00124         //end swapping e1 and e2
00125         x2->rgt = new TreeNode(GAMMA);
00126         x2->rgt->lft = new TreeNode(LAMBDA);
00127         x2->rgt->lft->rgt = e1; // the new lambda's right
00128         x2->rgt->lft->lft = x1; // the new lambda's left has now x1 who's first sibling is e2
00129         lft = x2;
00130         break;
00131       case REC:
00132         if(lft->_type != BINDING){
00133           throw "Subtree not standardised: case REC";
00134         };
00135         _type = BINDING;
00136         x = lft->lft;
00137         e = lft->lft->rgt;
00138         x->rgt = NULL;
00139         lft = x; //removing the reference to the old = node
00140         temp = new TreeNode(GAMMA);
00141         x->rgt = temp;
00142         temp-> lft = new TreeNode(YSTAR);
00143         temp->lft->rgt = new TreeNode(LAMBDA);
00144         temp->lft->rgt->lft = new TreeNode(x->_value, x->_type); // use copy constructor later ?? what is a copy constructor?
00145         temp->lft->rgt->lft->rgt = e;
00146         break;
00147       case FCN_FORM:
00148         _type = BINDING;
00149         temp = lft;
00150         while(temp->rgt->rgt != NULL){
00151           new_temp = new TreeNode(LAMBDA);
00152           new_temp->lft = temp->rgt; //temp->rgt is the current V therefore temp is the previous V
00153           temp->rgt = new_temp;
00154           temp = new_temp->lft;   
00155         };
00156         break;
00157       case LAMBDA:
00158         temp = lft;
00159         while(temp->rgt->rgt != NULL){
00160           new_temp = new TreeNode(LAMBDA);
00161           new_temp->lft = temp->rgt; //temp->rgt is the current V therefore temp is the previous V
00162           temp->rgt = new_temp;
00163           temp = temp->rgt;       
00164         };
00165         break;
00166       case AND:
00167         _type = BINDING;
00168         temp = lft;
00169         lft = NULL;
00170         lft = new TreeNode(COMMA);
00171         lft->rgt = new TreeNode(TAU);
00172         while(temp!=NULL){
00173           lft->rgt->add_child(temp->lft->rgt);//adding children to the tau node
00174           temp->lft->rgt = NULL;
00175           lft->add_child(temp->lft);//adding children to the comma node
00176           temp = temp->rgt;
00177         };
00178         break;
00179         case AT:
00180         _type = GAMMA;  
00181         e1 = lft;
00182         n = e1->rgt;
00183         e2 = e1->rgt->rgt;
00184         lft = new TreeNode(GAMMA);
00185         lft->rgt = e2;
00186         lft->lft = n;
00187         n->rgt = NULL;
00188         lft->lft->rgt = e1;
00189         e1->rgt = NULL;
00190         break;
00191       };
00192       //cout << "END of standardizing:" << to_s() << endl; 
00193     };
00194     void _pretty_print(int level){
00195       for(int i=0; i <level; i++){
00196         cout << ".";
00197       }
00198       cout << to_s() << " " << endl;
00199       if(lft != NULL)
00200         lft->_pretty_print(level + 1);
00201       if(rgt != NULL)
00202         rgt->_pretty_print(level);
00203     };
00204 
00205 
00206     void _init_lft_rgt(){
00207       lft = NULL;
00208       rgt = NULL;
00209     };
00210   };
